alert.note: Alert for Orange County Coastal; Orange County Inland (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 13 at 8:06PM PDT until March 15 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: .Heavy rain may fall on a deep primed snowpack leading to the melt increasing. Flows in rivers may increase quickly and reach critical levels. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following areas, Orange County Coastal Areas, Orange County Inland Areas, San Bernardino and Riverside County Valleys-The Inland Empire and Santa Ana Mountains and Foothills. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A Pacific storm system, fed by elevated moisture from an Atmospheric River, will spread widespread moderate to heavy rainfall across the area. Several additional inches of rainfall on already saturated soils, will likely produce rapid runoff, resulting in local flooding at time of peak rainfall rates. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Orange County Coastal; Orange County Inland
